Reviews.Title: “Pluses and minuses of The Beverly Laurel Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mamie66
Reviews.Content: The pluses: Location is great. Hot water and water pressure in shower is great. The front desk was great (we had even left one of our bags outside our car and they found it and held it for us!). The minuses: just a general feeling of "could be cleaner" - bathroom was dusty, found hairs on sheets and toilet (assume it is from the cleaning staff :) Charges for "incidentals" not explained at check-in (for "energy fee" and parking). Toilet wouldn't flush and upon arriving in the room on the first day, I had to plunge it (myself) three times before it finally worked (but it remained working for the rest of the time). If I could afford a nicer place, I would not stay there again. But for what we paid, it was good enough.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT PLACE (4th time)”
Reviews.Author: LONNOY
Reviews.Content: so well located, nice diner for meals all day and night, rooms clean , the staff is very charming and the price really interesting. It was my 4th visit and I shall return this summer.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay! Will stay again.”
Reviews.Author: EmilyAustral
Reviews.Content: This place is in a great location. Our room was massive with a full kitchen. It's great having free parking and Swingers diner right there. Good view of the Hollywood sign. Walking distance to the Grove, Farmers Market, Beverly Centre and the Tar Pits.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Aimee K
Reviews.Content: This hotel was old but was in a great location. We were close to everything hollywood has to offer. The hotel is older, but has come great character. The rooms are very outdated, and the beds are hard (although all 4 members of our group expresssed amazing sleeps!). We joked the carpets in the rooms needed to be shampooed, but honestly for a 2-star hotel I feel like we lucked out with the location. The front desk man when we checked out was a little odd. He seemed nice but there seemed to be a communication challenge. The second man we checked out with was adorable and hilarious. The parking and internet are both $5.00 each /night so that was VERY reasonable as other hotels in the area were double the price with internet of $10-15 and parking of $20-30. If you are expecing an amazing luxiarlly hotel don't go here, but if you are looking for something afforable and quaint, stay here. I personally don't like all the luxiary so I really enjoyed my stay! We will be back. Also the Swingers Coffee shop is unreal! Breakfast 2 days was AMAZING! Some good quality food! We had a misunderstanding with one server as 4 of us were paying so we under-tipped by a few bucks and she let it be known that we did that. It was an honest mistake but we heard her complaining before we even left the cafe. That turned us off a bit, we did go back in and give her another $5.00.

Reviews.Title: “A retro motor inn in a perfect spot!”
Reviews.Author: Nebtravler
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a lower cost place in the Hollywood area to be close to friends and attractions. This renovated motor lodge is so lovely! It's amazing to find a place like this still going. The drive in check-in courtyard is beautiful with a pool in the courtyard as well. Parking is reasonable and inside too. The rooms were clean although you could tell the age. Bedding was great as well. Not alot of extras but we had our own toiletries so not a problem. Old fashioned keys and doors and a split level floor arrangement which was fun. We walked to The Grove shopping area, just a few blocks, and felt secure. We will stay again if in the area. The cafe on the corner was excellent as well!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay!!”
Reviews.Author: berlyk1127
Reviews.Content: My family of four spent three nights at this hotel over the summer. We were vacationing and wanted to see the "usual" tourist attractions...Walk of Fame, Hollywood Blvd, Universal Studios, WB Studios, the beach, etc. This location was excellent, within 5-20 minutes of everything by car. The hotel itself has a kitsche feel to it, like old hollywood glamour. I felt like we were staying in an old style apartment rather than a hotel, and that gave it a homier feel. We have two teenage boys, ages 16 and 19, and the area was cool for them to hang out in. Close to the grove, the mall, theatres, etc. My 19 year old LOVED hanging out at Swingers, the coffee shop at the hotel. We enjoyed it as well, and their coffee was amazing! The hotel has a pool, but we didn't use it...too busy otherwise but it looked good. The staff was very helpful and friendly. Parking is onsite and convenient. This is a wonderful place to stay if you want a place of you "own" to use as a base for visiting L.A. We will definitely stay here again, and highly recommend. Our stay was great!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Good Location, but no extras”
Reviews.Author: Karen H
Reviews.Content: We chose the Beverly Laurel for its location and that worked out very well for the three of us. We were able to walk from our hotel to the museum and to other neighborhoods that we wanted to vist. The hotel was clean and the beds were comfortable, but there were no extras in the room to make us feel more welcomed or taken care of . No coffee pot for tea or coffee in the room, no little hand lotion or conditioner. No complimentary breakfast and no coffee or computer in the lobby. The price was good and I would stay there again if I wanted to be in that location, but I would have realistic expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Great location , nice hotel, but could have been better”
Reviews.Author: dragswarup
Reviews.Content: We reached there , and were greeted by a gentleman, the check in was smooth. Parking was in the basement which was charged. Rooms were small but cozy. Overall very neat. Somehow was not as good as we expected it to be. Old construction.The day we left there was also a movie crew which was shooting in the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Old and not updated”
Reviews.Author: Deanna P
Reviews.Content: Old cracked peeling walls. The phone and the refrigerator did not work. There were missing doors on the bathroom cabinets, The staff threw away or stole my tempurpedic pillow within hours of my departure. Owner was rude and would not resolve the situation.

Reviews.Title: “Cool, inexpensive and great location”
Reviews.Author: Joan M
Reviews.Content: I've been staying in and recommending this place for years. It isn't a big chain, glamorous or sleek, you won't bump into any celebrities in the motel itself, but you might in Swinger's, the 24 hipster cafe attached to the place. Always clean, welcoming and a fairly recent remodel, I recommend it to any family or friends looking for a reasonably priced place to stay in a decent neighborhood. In all the years I've sent folks here, I've only heard rave reviews. For tourists, it's centrally located, so a trip to the Valley for Universal is reasonable - as is a trip to Santa Monica. You are a few blocks from Beverly Hills, a mile or so from the Sunset Strip and walking distance to some of the best restaurants in LA. Same goes for shoppers, close to Rodeo Drive, but also to all the cool Melrose shops, vintage stores, even the newly dubbed La Cienega design Quarter. Highly Recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Our place in LA”
Reviews.Author: bosbes
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay here and it was even better than the first in 2010. They charge $5,- a day now for parking but I think this is a good decision because last time we found it hard finding a space to park when coming back late at night. I guess there were just too many people parking at the hotel and not being an actual guest. In the parking there is an old abandoned car which I really like and definitely not should be removed because its part of the charm of the hotel. Both times there was a film crew shooting at the hotel which immediately gives you the Hollywood feel. Bruce and Roberto from the front desk were both very nice. We had package shipped to the hotel and they took care of it which was really nice. Price is a bit high for my budget but reasonable because the location is perfect. Walking distance to the Beverly center, Melrose for shopping, Wholefoods market and Petersen Automotive and Lacma museums. I asked for a top floor room at the back and we got room 310 which felt more like a small appartment than a hotel room. It had 2 windows, a kitchen, 2 queen beds, a table, two chairs, large closets and normal size bathroom in it. Beds were clean, comfortable and heating was working fine (there weren't extra blankets and it was cold at night so I had the turn the heater on, so putting extra blankets in the closets will save energy). Also the pattern of the bed covers was very nice. Our other room had purple which was a bit dark but these were yellow. And it was super quiet! We felt like moving in immediately and staying forever :) Tv channels were poor and they charge extra for wifi but this didn't bother us because you're only there to sleep. There were only 2 lights in the room this was a bit dark when you need to repack and reorganise your stuff before going on the plane. No breakfast included but try the Swingers diner in the same building, they have everything you need. Can't wait to stay here again, Beverly Laurel is the best !

Reviews.Title: “ITS MINI MIAMI STYLE HOTEL IN CALIFORNIA ** GREAT PRICE **”
Reviews.Author: sumerdeijz
Reviews.Content: What can I say to make you not want to go here ? Except that If your looking for a good hotel not LA ritz , but good price , free parking yup when you can get it fills up fast and damn internet 6 dollars for the day , unheard off , and it has a pool, not heated but who cares when its hot out , and the restaurant SWINGERS which is attached to eat is the best food and service that I have had for a dinner style and I have been alot of places over the yrs The rooms are old style motel , two beds , shower and some have microwaves , which is what we had . The rooms are done in themes and are safe to stay at , you do hear alot but that is why they are called motels , but don't let that scare you this place is a DIAMOND MIND for price and area , and has elevators for the disabled The staff are good , place is clean and your right down the street from the GROVE, and the big mall Tones of places to walk and shop , and if your into working out the EASTON is across the street to pay and work out good place clean and the staff are swell You cant not take this place for the price's , the bus line is easy to navigate also and the one bus takes you all the way to the SANTA MONICA PIER its long but you see the city for free and it was pretty safe considering all the horror stories that come out of LA

Reviews.Title: “Great stay and excellent value”
Reviews.Author: Laura68771
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights and could not be happier with the place. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Room was clean and the bed was so comfortable. Hotel was close to Hollywood attractions and nice bars and restaurants, 20 mins drive from pretty much everything i.e. Venice Beach, Hollywood Hills, Downtown, Burbank. No problem with security and we felt safe walking around at night. Swingers downstairs was nice, but was a bit disappointed with the breakfast after reading so many good reviews. Will definitely be back here if ever staying in LA again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!”
Reviews.Author: Tricky00
Reviews.Content: Very happy with our stay. We were upgraded upon arrival. Very nice desk staff. Very clean and comfortable room. It is very central to LACMA and Hollywood attractions. Actually the bus stop for Bus 217 is a couple of blocks away on Fairfax. The Grove ,CBS and Farmer's Market are walking distance. Microwave and fridge . Really awesome 'period' hotel. Swingers coffee shop is excellent as well. If you are on a budget and want to see eveything I recommed the Beverly Laurel.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in central location”
Reviews.Author: joe j
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for multiple nights. Here are a few comments: Fair price for a hotel in this area. Researched most hotels in the area. Many more expensive hotels exist on Beverly Blvd, if you want to pay the higher price. This hotel is a decent place to stay and caters to the avg consumer. If you need a luxury hotel, try elsewhere. Rooms are roomy and have MW and refrigerator. Staff was friendly and helpful. The Swingers restaurant at the street level provides a convenient place for good meals. Also, Whole Foods Market and the Farmers Market are within walking distance (3 blocks). Other fast food options are available on Beverly Blvd. Neighborhood is safe to walk in day or night. Cedar Sinai Hospital is about one mile away. This hotel provides easy access to the hospital if you are coming to LA for treatment of health issues. The Beverly Center is nearby and provides many shopping options. Easy access to CBS Studios (3 blocks) - Show tickets can be obtained via www.mytvtickets.com. We were able to get tickets for "America's Got Talent - Finals." Ask for a room on the alley side - would be less noise than on Beverly Blvd side.

Reviews.Title: “Don't trust this hotel”
Reviews.Author: m m
Reviews.Content: Reserved a room with two beds at the rate of $120 over three weeks in advance. We arrive late, grab the key and find a room with one bed. The night guy tells us the hotel is totally sold out, and apparently the day guy changed our reservation that same day. He apologizes that he can't offer a second room, agrees to 50% rate discount and suggests a fold-up cot for the night, which obviously we must accept. The next morning at check-out the room charge is $98.10 = 18% and the day guy refuses to drop the rate any more. The Manager Roberto Nepomuceno is out of town, with no email address on the business card. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Probably the best in the area”
Reviews.Author: colorknit
Reviews.Content: It is hard to find a good place to stay in this area. Selection is limited, especially if money is an issue. This is probably your best bet. Rooms are immaculately clean and equipped with a refrigerator and microwave. Nice swimming pool, but it was too cold to swim during most of our stay. Parking is not free and is not easy. Hotel has a limited number of spaces, not enough to accommodate all guests. So we did not feel easy being away too late in the evening, and we were always anxious about getting one. A smaller car is strongly recommended if you have a choice. If you are unable to get a space, you will have to settle for metered parking on the street. Internet access is not free either. It is $5.95 per device for a 24-hour period. Signing on is not easy either.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, great value”
Reviews.Author: emanningbx
Reviews.Content: This place was a great value for the location and amenities it provided. It's located in a section of Los Angeles that is very conveniently located to downtown and the Laurel Canyon area. It's about 10 miles from LAX. There isn't much to speak of within walking distance but there are alot of interesting things within a mile or two. The motel itself offers many surprising amenities for the price-separate kitchen with frig, microwave, oven, and table; Tempurapedic mattresses, roomy bathroom, super super clean. Parking costs $5 a day but our rental car was so big that it wouldn't fit in their lot so we parked it on the street overnight for free and the motel refunded our parking fee without us even asking. The proprietor is friendly and nice and was very helpful with giving directions to LAX. Attached to the motel is a cool diner that's open 6:30 am to 4 am; we saw Common eating there.

Reviews.Title: “It is what it is”
Reviews.Author: Buddha777
Reviews.Content: This place has a certain '50s charm, and the room rate was reasonable. However, while there, the elevator was out 90% of the time, the pool was closed one day, and parking spaces were scarce. I heard there are some rooms that have been updated nicely, but we didn't have one of them. On the plus side, the shower was fabulous and the downstairs diner, Swingers, had great food and very nice staff. Location was very good for us on this particular trip. Very close to The Grove/Farmer's Market, CBS Studios and Hollywood.

Reviews.Title: “Fun and nostalgic with 50s feel”
Reviews.Author: Robtex52
Reviews.Content: For a budget hotel, this is really nice. The 50s style is fun. The beds are great which is my most important feature. It is located close to many fun things, and we were able to walk many places, which beats driving in the traffic! We had a shower/bath combo in our room which was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable location and value for money”
Reviews.Author: melissaandmatt
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Beverly Laurel Motel for 5 nights and had a great stay - the location is amazing as it's pretty much central within LA. Lots of interesting things are nearby: Farmer's Market, The Grove shopping area, LACMA, and the surrounding Fairfax District with lots of interior design shops and good vintage clothes shops. There's also buses which take you to Los Feliz and Silver Lake from two blocks north which is really handy. The room we had was decorated in a 50's style, with a kitchenette which was handy for having breakfast and we also had a great view of the Hollywood sign (quite far in the distance but still...!) All of the staff are really friendly, and went out of their way to be kind and help out with taxi's etc. I couldn't recommend this hotel enough, and have also recommended it to friends of ours as a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: funnytraveler1
Reviews.Content: I recently visited Hollywood and was searching for a reasonably priced hotel near some places of interest. A friend recommended the Beverly Laurel and boy am I glad she did. First off, the hotel is located within three blocks of the LA Farmers Market/Grove shopping center. Lots of restaurants, clubs and stores are all within walking distance. As far as the rooms go--WOW! Big room with a huge bathroom, including a walk-in shower. I also loved the decor--lots of great movie star portraits, including M. Monroe. Internet is available for $6 and best of all, the place has free parking!! I only paid $100/night and after staying in lots of places in LA on previous trips,I can say I will always look to the Beverly Laurel first. Other pluses are it's attached to a hip coffee shop (Swingers), that's open late and serves good food. Also, the staff is friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “I didn't like it at first, but it worked out great”
Reviews.Author: lydia61358
Reviews.Content: We were a little turned off by the area at first. It seemed a bit seedy, but you soon find out, all of LA/Hollywood is like that. The rooms were very clean, the mattresses were extremely comfortable. We're all big bath people and were disappointed that the room only had a shower, but the double-showers were great. The pool was clean, but too cold to swim in, unfortunatley. A little too noisy at night, but not that bad. A funky little place. Lots of young hipsters staying there. Very close to everything. Swingers was great!

Reviews.Title: “The hotel is a bit odd (straight out of the 1950s) - but Swingers nextdoor is AWESOME”
Reviews.Author: alison_spring
Reviews.Content: Arrived here after a long haul flight from Sydney. The hotel is straight out of the 1950s, they even had a photo of Marilyn Monroe hanging on the wall, but the place is clean qnd comfortable if you just want to stay the night and crash at a reasonable price. The hotel isnt near anything in particular, (there is a cinema down the road) except the cafe 'Swingers' is an absoulte must. Its so cool, a LA diner serving milkshakes and burgers all through the night. A great place to eat on our first night in the USA. Even if you dontstay at the Motel when you are in LA, go to Swingers!

Reviews.Title: “good value - but check your room!”
Reviews.Author: Maybeitsbecause
Reviews.Content: Pros - very good value, great location - within walking distance to Farmers Market / the Grove / Beverly Centre / Melrose / funky shops on West Third street. Swingers Diner serves great food . We were also able to catch the bus directly to downtown Cons - our room (215) was right over the diner and there was a lot of noise into the early hours (the place stays open until 4am). Also we developed some strange bites during our stay, which we can only put down to bed bugs. However friends who stayed here previously had not had any problems so hopefully this is an isolated incident.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, very Clean”
Reviews.Author: chas29644
Reviews.Content: What a great place to stay when going to the Price Is Right!!! The room was very clean. Swingers is a great place to eat. The only issue is parking, we had no place to park. Went to the desk and he found me parking in the Hotel pool area. The employees were very nice and helpful. Thank you for a Great stay.

Reviews.Title: “The beverly Laurel is the best Hollywood hotel for the price!”
Reviews.Author: rocknreconstruct
Reviews.Content: Once again.., stayed at the beverly laurel and stayed in a huge room on the third floor with a separate kitchen with stove, fridge and charming vintage yet modern decor.. love this place.. so convenient to everything, and such a deal for the quality! Thanks so much!

Reviews.Title: “You won't find better value”
Reviews.Author: SweetTater32
Reviews.Content: Stayed here while I was receiving medical treatment at a nearby hospital (I know, I know, good times..). This motel surprised me with its funky 50s character, which is an added bonus for what's essentially budget accommodations in the middle of a very expensive city. It's in a walkable area and the cafe's great. The staff was professional yet laid back. The only drawback was noise. With all the rooms located around a busy central courtyard, some of my nights were often interrupted by the clatter of heels and high pitched squeals from those having a better time than me. And who wants to hear that? Overall, an EXCELLENT deal at a place with lots of old L.A. character.

Reviews.Title: “Conveniently located, good beds, clean, good value for money”
Reviews.Author: APM_01
Reviews.Content: Luxurious it's not. Funky 50's-style decor. But it's located adjacent to Farmer's Market, The Grove, CBS Television City, Cantor's Delicatessen and a short walk to Melrose Avenue's trendy shops. The rooms are clean, the beds are comfy, and it's a good deal price-wise. The sole drawback is that all rooms face onto an echoey central courtyard, and more than once we've been awakened in the middle of the night by inconsiderate loud-talking patrons entering or leaving the restaurant downstairs.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Free Parking, Internet, Upgraded Rooms”
Reviews.Author: MovieDoug
Reviews.Content: This hotel is what I consider to be the best little secret in LA. LA is not cheap and when you compare hotels in this same price range, you will not find a better place. The rooms have been upgraded with Hollywood memorabilia, and the bathrooms are really nice. While others complained about the beds, I didn't notice anything uncomfortable and slept great. There is also Free Parking which is also rare for LA. There is a charge for the internet. Swingers Cafe is awesome !! You can get some great rates and AAA Discounts if you shop online through some of the hotel wholesaler sites.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - simple but adequate”
Reviews.Author: DannyG3523
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Beverly Laurel for 4 nights, basic ammenities, quiet, comfortable. Swingers diner great selection of specials at reasonable prices. Room clean and well maintained. Will return on our next trip to LA.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, ageing typical motel, excellent diner Swinger's down the hotel”
Reviews.Author: louisJFrance
Reviews.Content: Typical motel, a little old. The room was spacious but noisy (lots of traffic on this street). The location is very good. And the best thing about this hotel is the Swinger's diner, one the best diner.

Reviews.Title: “overpriced at $149/night. would not stay again, just didn't feel clean to me”
Reviews.Author: my_opinionCalifornia
Reviews.Content: my husband and i stayed here 1 night to attend The Price is Right taping. there were no available rooms online so i called directly and got a room for $149 which i thought was overpriced but looking at the reviews of other motels in this area it seemed this was the better one so i booked it. NEGATIVE- when we walked in all windows were open and it smelled like paint? the building is old but there was updated carpet, paint and bedspread. everything else seemed to be original. i would not use the kitchen. it didn't seem clean to me. it had 2 full size beds (not queen) and pillows were flat. overpriced room. POSITIVE- walking distance to Price is Right taping, Farmer's Market, close to Sunset & Hollywood blvd. Parking is free. OVERALL- I would not stay here again. i would stay further and drive to these locations and i would not recommend this motel to my friends. At price is right taping we met people who stayed at the Roadhouse. it sounded like that motel was cheaper but worse than this one.

Reviews.Title: “Charmingly, atmospheric hotel”
Reviews.Author: aurora_mae
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a few nights in June and it was great, Easily found, smoothly checked in. Comfortable, spacious room with a FABULOUS bathroom. Just a great size, with mirrors on two walls. Microwave, fridge and pictures of old, movie stars as standard. TV was fine and swimming pool, although freezing was lovely. Lift to all floors including the (free!) underground car park. That made us feel safe and secure, knowing our rental was not left randomly on street. The attached Swingers restaurant was just great... Food was fab, and though one waitress took a dislike to me, presumably because of a like for my boyfriend, the service was great too. Brent Bolthouse's workplace was next door, too so anyone hoping to catch a glimpse of mediocre reality-tv celebs, keep your eyes peeled. Melrose and Fairfax were a pleasant dander away, as was the Farmer's Market. Everything else was dead easy to drive to. The only issue - and it's a big one - is that they charged us twice. We used a U.K. debit and despite explaining that when they 'froze' the money in our account, it would come out, they seemed to not understand and went ahead with their duplicate debiting anyway, We had to then spend an hour on the phone to the bank back home and only got it sorted because my OH works for that particular bank and knew what to say. Otherwise we would have had no money for the last week of our stay.... Yikes! However, we didn't feel robbed. Simply a pretty awkward misunderstanding and it didn't ruin our stay. Just be warned what card you're using if you're from the U.K

Reviews.Title: “great location, hard bed”
Reviews.Author: TikimanAlameda_CA
Reviews.Content: I gave this place 3 stars because depending on what you are looking for this could either be a 1 star or a 5 star. Location is great. Adjacent to Melrose and Fairfax District and The Grove/Farmer's Market and in the middle of LA between downtown and Santa Monica each of which are only about 20 min away or less with no traffic. Great price, there are some cheaper motels nearby but most are more $$. Food: Swinger's diner is downstairs and is almost open 24 hours, Canter's is almost waling distance and is open 24 hours. Unlike my past experiences and despite several reviews here on Yelp, the Swinger's staff were actually very nice and helpful. Especially the two waitresses we had early Friday morning. Awesome health food market right across the street and huge Erewhon market three blocks away with full deli. My room was conveniently located close to the stairs and elevator to parking basement and had good sun and view of the pool. We were in room 104. The hotel looks nice and inviting, the room looks nice, but after living in it for a little while I realize that there are a few conveniences missing. And I,m not talking about extras like chocolates on the bed or free bottled water or ironing board and iron. I mean a HOT shower! How bout a coffee maker? How bout conditioner to go with the shampoo? Lotion would be nice. How bout a phone book, pen, clock!?! Big plus was that the room has a fridge and a microwave, bummer is that there was no dinnerware or mugs so the microwave went unused. Another big plus is the free hotel parking except that during prime dining hours @ Swingers the patrons use the hotel parking and apparently the hotel staff don,t enforce the Hotel Guests Only policy. Hotel staff and cleaning staff are nice. Guests seemed nice and were a mix of young crowd, thirty somethings on a budget, and a few families. I am sure that at least one of my neighbors was having a really good time because he let everyone know by screaming and singing and yelling at the top of his lungs for about 15 minutes at about 2:30 in the morning (not sure what time it was cause there is no clock in the room!) Rooms can be a little noisy when guests walk down the halls talking (or scream at the top of their lungs). The walls are thin. If it were hot outside, which it often is in LA, the pool seems like it would be really fun. But it was 69 degrees and the unheated pool was freezing. Bed is hard, so are the pillows. So hard that I tossed and turned every night I spent there. So, to recap: What you get: Good location, good price, free parking, pool, microwave, fridge What you don't get: good night's rest, hot shower

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING!!!”
Reviews.Author: projectBNE
Reviews.Content: Absolutley loved it... Great location - Walking distance to Fairfax, The Grove, Beverly Center and even Hollywood if you're feeling energetic. Clean, retro rooms were great and FREE undercover carparking was a big plus as well. Swingers Diner downstairs was great too! Would recommend it and any/everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Turned out to be a godsend”
Reviews.Author: si_vorny
Reviews.Content: On arival late at night and after meeting a rather un-enthusiastic receptionist it was not promising. The rooms look like they would be more akin to an hourly rate, with a huge mirror and tiger print beadspread and curtains and with the lack of any safes, plus the unfortunately named swingers cafe downstaris I wasn't sure i'd make it through the night. This is however a really nice motel, in a great position and walking distance to the farmers market which was beautiful with great resturants and pedestrianised shopping. The two other real bonuses are the aformentioned swingers cafe which did fantastic food and free parking which is hard to find in the middle of LA. For a Brit driving in America, knowing that when you get back to the hotel you've got free parking was a great relief as you definately can't get anywhere in LA without a car. One bonus is that if you have a room close enough to swingers you can tap into their free wifi rather than having to pay the hotels rates. If i were to go again i'd probably stay further out of LA and try and get free parking at a slightly plusher hotel as your going to have to drive anyway whats an extra 10 mins.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, good value, would return to this hotel”
Reviews.Author: beachygirlga
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great value. Don't expect luxury. Just a clean place to stay, and a great rate. We didn't use the pool, and didn't ever see anyone in it. Free parking was nice, because this is hard to find in LA. Swingers restaurant downstairs was GREAT for breakfast. The freshest eggs I have ever tasted. Will return to this hotel, and would not hesitate to recommend.

Reviews.Title: “A fab little gem.”
Reviews.Author: MalyManchester
Reviews.Content: Stayed at The Beverly Laurel for four nights at the end of July. Check in was easy, the room was big and clean and very comfortable (with a sink/microwave/fridge - very handy when you are travelling), the pool was small but great to cool you down in the heat. The hotel is in a really convenient location and the free parking is a bonus - we had breakfast at Swingers Diner one morning and enjoyed it (though the coffee was pretty poor). It's not a five star hotel, but we loved the style of the whole place.

Reviews.Title: “Not Quite What It's Cracked Up To Be”
Reviews.Author: ScrittiPolitti
Reviews.Content: The hotel seems nice on the outside... a perfect freeze of a 1950s Motor Hotel. It is fun and kitchy, but not that great. First off, instead of fixing water damage in the bathroom, they simply painted over it. The room had a slight list to it and the gaps in the door let all sorts of light in. Parking was a nightmare. We could not fight a space in their very tight garage or their tiny, tiny carports. The desk said we could park on the street. We ended up with a $55 parking ticket... thanks City of Los Angeles. Plus, there were some sketchy looking people hanging around (we were ok with the punk rock kids, we expected that). We decided that was enough so we cancelled and stayed at another hotel down the road. Swinger's Coffee Shop looks really cool, but the food was just so-so. On the plus side, like Frommers said... it was very clean. We were greeted by the strong odor of bleach when we first arrived.

Reviews.Title: “Nice motel in good location”
Reviews.Author: AW-GE
Reviews.Content: Based in a good location near to The Glade shopping centre, the Farmer's Market, and the Beverly Centre. Parking provided and good American Diner next to hotel. The room was clean and spacious and included a kitchen sink area and microwave and the bed was very comfortable. From the motel it's a fairly easy drive to the Hollywood sign, Hollywood Blvd, Sunset Blvd, and Universal Stuidos.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Farmer's Market and Swinger's Coffee Shop”
Reviews.Author: labonvoyer
Reviews.Content: Several times I have visited LA, I've stayed at the Farmer's Daughter hotel to be near the Farmer's Market/Grove. The prices have gone UP. I tried this hotel which is an 8 minute walk from the Farmer's Market. The Beverly Laurel is clean and has a refrigerator and microwave in the room. The office staff is very nice. They have a pleasant pool area in the middle of the hotel complex. They do not charge for parking (Farmer's daughter does and only has valet so that also means additional tip). We tried the coffee shop Swingers attached to the hotel. It is very reasonably priced and although simple, the food is high quality.

Reviews.Title: “Pray that your plumbing works”
Reviews.Author: rjmoli
Reviews.Content: I'll start with the pros. The reviews on this site are, for the most part, accurate. It does have a cool retro vibe - decor is adorable. Location is excellent, and there is free parking, which is important. The diner downstairs is FANTASTIC - we ate there several times and loved every meal, and the prices were quite reasonable. We were really prepared to love everything about this place. As long as everything in your room works, this hotel is great. So I assume that the majority of the reviews have been left by people whose rooms were functional, and probably the odds are in favor of that, so it may be worth the risk, particularly because LA hotels are so expensive. We would have been one of those reviews if we'd stayed in our first room, quite honestly. However, we had requested a king non-smoking and were given 2 doubles instead. We stayed there the first night, because we got in very late, and that room was nice, and everything worked. However, my husband is 6 foot 4, and the beds were WAY too small for him, and we couldn't share one (they were tiny), and since it was a romantic weekend away, we asked for a room change in the morning, and got one. No problem. This is when we discovered that if something in your room doesn't work, you're screwed. In the next room, the toilet was broken. We were told that maintenance couldn't come until THE NEXT DAY, so IF they could find one, we could have another room (like having a room with no toilet was a reasonable option!). In the room we were moved to, the shower was broken, and the answer was basically, "Tough, wait until maintenance comes tomorrow". The attitude of both people we spoke to about the shower (the night it broke and the next morning) was that we were being unreasonably fussy by expecting our plumbing to work correctly; one said "I know about YOU people - you SAID your last room had problems too" (as if we'd made it up) and the other said "So in every room you have, the shower is broken?" We calmly reminded him that no, the toilet was broken in the first room. However, we were pretty angry that no apologies were given and we were blamed for the problems; the usual response for a hotel in this case would be to apologize for having things in the room that weren't working, inconveniencing the guests. And they were pretty MAJOR things - it's not like the remote control was broken or something. Sadly, we had to agree that we wouldn't stay here again. Sure, we might get lucky and next time, our room might have no problems at all. Or we might have another broken toilet on a night that the entire hotel was booked - with this hotel's "we don't call maintenance until morning if only one room is having problems, no matter what" policy (this is what the front desk lady told us when we called about the shower), we could end up spending the night without a toilet, or having to pay for a room somewhere else just to get a room with a toilet that worked! That's not a chance we're willing to take.

Reviews.Title: “Cool, retro exterior - ok accommodation”
Reviews.Author: jodieb1983
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in Sept 08 during a road trip of Cali with my husband. I booked the hotel as is very retro and my husband and I are big fans of this style. When we got there, the room we were assigned to stank of cigarettes, so we asked to change and this was done with minimal fuss. The new room was better, although there definitely was a faint cigarette smell (not my favourite aroma!). The rooms were adequate, although I made sure I kept my shoes on all the time as the carpet actually made my husband's bare foot black. I kid you not. There is a pool but it seemed to be in permanent shade and I didn't see anyone in it. Looks good in photos though! There is free parking underground. Not sure why all the other reviewers say it's a nightmare - it was tight, but we had a Chrysler convertible which is definitely not a small car, and we managed fine. My guess is everyone else must be really bad drivers.. The best thing about this place was the Swingers diner next door. Very cool place to have breakfast, with good service, delish granola, lovely fruit salad. Location was very good - The Grove and the Farmer's Market are nearby which make for a fun evening. There is a FANTASTIC Mexican grill in the Farmer's Market. Think it was called something like Loqueidas. You'll know it as there's always a long queue, but totally worth the wait. There is also a great flea market on Sunday mornings at the local Fairfax high school. All in all, the place was cheap, service not bad, and great location. It wasn't the cleanest place in the world, but you can't win them all. I would definitely stay here again if it was just for one night. Any more than that and I think I would look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Clean rooms, great location. Good place to stay for under $100”
Reviews.Author: mdrtanner
Reviews.Content: We usually stay at the Farmer's Daughter on Fairfax but their prices went up so much this year we had to find a new place. We really like the location near the Farmer's Market/The Grove so I was pleased to find this hotel. It is a 10 min walk. The rooms are very clean and they put fresh sheets on the bed every night. The room was very basic. The hotel looks to have been built in the 60's with some upgrades. The bathrooms have been made over but I didn't see any that look like the pictures that were posted. However, everything was very clean. The staff was friendly. It seems that a lot of bands stay here while touring... we were also there due to touring and I had our 6 month old son with us. There are no thrills with this hotel but for the money it was perfect; affordable, clean and close to everything and in a good neighborhood. We got coffee at Swingers in the morning. We never had a problem with parking. There are about 16 stalls in the ramp below the hotel and it is a tight fit however right outside the ramp there are also slots you can pull into. We had a big SUV rental but never had problems parking underground. Their underground ramp was like most underground ramps in Los Angeles. I guess a lot of visitor's aren't used to the cramped parking. No one was ever in the pool but it was clean and nice. Internet was $6 for 24 hours.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value Hotel in West LA”
Reviews.Author: dp_2000NewYork
Reviews.Content: For the price, the Beverly Laurel is a great place. I lost my cell phone and the staff was very, very helpful to me. The coffee shop, Swingers, had great organic breakfasts. The bathroom was newly renovated and better than I expected, with good water pressure, large showers and even some marble around the sink. The hotel is basic, there is a small pool and no real lobby. But the location, price, and size of the rooms is great. Walk to the farmer's market and eat breakfast. Also, it's across the street from a great gym - only $15 a session.

Reviews.Title: “Retro Fun in an Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: CoopToronto
Reviews.Content: Luxury isn't really the name of the game at the Beverly Laurel. This 50-60's style motel is Retro Chic (particularly the AWESOME coffee shop / diner called SWINGERS which is attached). Wait staff provides a hint of hipster 'tude but the food was great and you may spot some C-List celebrities as we did during our stay. Swingers juke-box has the most eclectic music selection ever, ranging from Misfits and Minor Threat to Lee Hazlewood and more! Rooms were very basic although ours had a kitchenette with fridge & microwave. Our room was fairly clean but the bathroom needs updating pretty desperately, with the shower drain backing up and our tub filling with disgusting black goop. (to his credit, hotel maintenance fellow came to access the situation immediately and worked hard for at least an hour to correct the problem). Pool was small but functional and surrounded by well established vines galore. Free parking was a plus but fills up quick (patrons of Swingers I suppose). BL's location is key... close to the Grove, Farmers Market (an excellent "must see" adventure in itself...great food, particularly the cajun booth!), Le Brea Tar Pits, etc... Overall decent value for the money, friendly staff and great location make the Beverly Laurel a winner, so long as you're not expecting high end luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed...”
Reviews.Author: trentonkid
Reviews.Content: After reading all of the glowing reviews of the Beverly Laurel hotel on tripadvisor and expedia I was pretty optimistic about my selection. On arrival the check in was fast and easy, the desk clerk cordial but not very knowledgeable about the area. We were assigned room 109 and proceeded to park the car. The parking situation is dreadful albeit "free". The hotel has approximately 50 rooms and there aren't even half that many parking spaces available. When you are lucky enough to find an open space the maneuvering needed to be done is pretty ridiculous as the "garage" is extremely small. The open air "alleyway" parking stalls aren't much better as several of them have significant dips that causes the undercarriage of your car to scrape the pavement. The room itself seemed okay at first glance, decently decorated with a king size bed. We must not have been assigned to one of the "remodeled" rooms that others have talked about here earlier. The bathroom was old and in desperate need of repair although the shower was extremely large and big enough for two. We did experience a minor ant problem on two different occasions which seemed to be limited to the bathroom area. The fridge and microwave were ancient and should be replaced. The bed was very comfortable and provided a good nights sleep. With the setup of the hotel you can hear everything that is taking place outside, sirens, voices, doors slamming, etc; earplugs would probably be a good idea. The hotel does have a good location going for it although we did notice several homeless people sleeping in front of stores in the area of beverly and fairfax. We ate at Swingers for breakfast on one occasion, the food and service were good and I would recommend giving it a try. I would probably look elsewhere in the future even though the rate of $125 a night is not over the top. I chose this place over another hotel in the area primarily because of the free parking and would not have if I had known the problems it presented...disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Unxepectedly Disappointed.”
Reviews.Author: Chiaki88
Reviews.Content: Whenever I choose a hotel, I check TripAdvisor at first, because the reviews are very depandable and accurate. However, Bevery Laurel Hotel was an exception. I don't understand why everybody gives 4 and 5 stars for this place. It's just an old motel with Hollywood style funky furniture. Our bathroom shelf was broken, the lines were very tired, toilet tank had dust and hair... I didn't feel comfortable. Also, you hear loud street noise, which I thought was a storm all night. One good discovery was the diner on the ground floor, Swingers. Good price, good food and good service. I highly recommend this restaurant. If you are looking for a clean well-maintained hotel, you might not be so happy with this one.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and nostalgic”
Reviews.Author: Bakesie
Reviews.Content: We took a road trip to Los Angeles on a budget and this was the perfect place! We chose the Beverly Laurel because they accept pets. The property is well manicured and extremely nostalgic! The pool and landscaping was a true throw back to the 1960's. The rooms are not the most luxurious rooms and have very little amenities but they are equipped with a fridge and microwave. Free parking was a plus. Most importantly, the location was amazing. We were close to everything! The Grove, Chameau (great French Moroccan restaurant we walked to), Farmer's Market and Boutiques. I would stay here again and again because it was easy and the price was amazing. We brought our own snacks and drinks for the room and Swingers (great diner) was right downstairs. If you are looking for luxury, don't come here. If you are more interested in a great location and don't plan on spending much time in the room this place is perfect. *Bring your own soap and shampoo. Their selection is pretty basic.

Reviews.Title: “Retro hotel with great location!”
Reviews.Author: LondonEyeSpy
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after hearing great reviews towards location and were not expecting that much considering the price however we were extremely impressed!! Contrary to some reviews on here we found the amenities to be great, new bathroom with wet room style shower, two clean soft double beds, nice subtle fifties decor and all you need for a comfortable stay. We are not saying this hotel would rival the 5 star hotels in the city but if you're a fan of retro/vintage this place is a must and the price cannot be beaten! The Swingers diner downstairs is great for breakfast too. Location as said before is great and I would recommend going to the Farmers Market round the corner and Fairfax/Melrose are great for vintage shopping by foot.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, simple, good value”
Reviews.Author: scq7
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 1 night while visting LA and liked this hotel. The hotel is good value and the diner downstairs great! Location is convenient but as for all things in LA - you need a car to get around.

Reviews.Title: “Old school? Or just old?”
Reviews.Author: ASU_Sundevils
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure why I booked the Beverly Laurel - I think I read something about it in the LA Times travel section. We (me, wife, 8-year-old daughter) stayed at the BL the nights of August 8-9. First things first - don't let the name fool you; this hotel is not in Beverly Hills. It is on Beverly Blvd but that doesn't make it Beverly Hills. The surrounding neighborhood isn't bad (although most of the houses have bars on the windows) but it sure isn't Beverly Hills. We checked in around 3:30 Friday afternoon. The manager (owner?) is very friendly. We had reserved a non-smoking refurbished room. We asked for something quiet (not facing the street) but he told us this wasn't available in a refurbished room. He could tell that I was disappointed with this news so he upgraded us at no charge to one of the refurbished studios that face the alley in back. The cost of the room was $119/night plus LA hotel tax plus $2/day energy surcharge; parking is included, which is very rare in LA. My wife gasped when she heard our room number as this room has been the subject of a bad previous TA review. We never had any trouble parking and only had to go into the underground garage once. All of the parking is covered - others have mentioned that it is a tight squeeze but much of the tightness is due to people not properly parking within their space. There is no security for the parking garage - even the underground area does not have a gate or any noticeable security cameras. You are reasonably close to everything - The Grove is less than a mile away as is Fred Segal (on Melrose). The hotel looks old - it is old. The hotel does not have a web site but there are pictures of it floating around on the web. The pictures of the refurbished rooms are flattering - the reality is much less flattering. Our room had been refurbished but that word means different things to different people. The room is old and it looks old. There is no dresser so you will have no drawers in which to put your clothes. The flat panel was nice but it was not HDTV and the remote didn't work (we didn't bother contacting management about this). The kitchen area is small and looks really old. The fridge is a step up from a dorm size fridge but still very small. There is all kinds of light coming into the room, especially around the door. The a/c is a wall unit that blows cold but is very loud. The bed was not very comfortable and the pillows are the worst I have ever had at a hotel (not much bigger than what you get on an airplane). The bathroom is reasonable in size and had been refurbished but still looked old. The towels will bring back memories of gym class and the toiletries ... well ... let's just say that you should bring your own. All you get is a bottle of really bad combo shampoo & conditioner and the cheapest little bar of soap that I've ever seen in a hotel. The water pressure is good and there is plenty of hot water. With the exception of the a/c unit the room was quiet at night although I can imagine that if you face the street and are close to Swingers that it will be noisy. From what I can tell room 303 is furthest away from any of the noise so that might be the one to request. We tried the pool but didn't last long in it as it isn't heated. Even as I child I didn't like cold pools - I'm certainly not going to change that opinion as an adult. The pool water appeared to be very clean. Swingers is OK - the price isn't bad nor is the food. We ate one dinner and one breakfast there - I don't feel a need to ever go back because there are just far too many great places to eat in LA. I got what I paid for in LA. If you are expecting this to be some hidden pocket of luxury in Beverly Hills for Motel 6 prices you will be sorely disappointed. But if you understand what you are getting then I think you will like this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Oh yeah!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: EL_GQ
Reviews.Content: I booked a room with Beverly Laurel for one night, and I must say this place, location, and price cannot be beat. Steps away from Fairfax you have eveything you need walking distance. The place even has a diner called Swingers that is open from 6am-4am. When I checked in the manager Robert was great. Down to earth personality he made me feel safe with no surpries. I was given a kind size bed and the room was spacious with a micowave, fridge, and a little kitchen. Everything in the room worked, ac, tv, warm/cold water. The bed was well along with the pillows. You can even get high speed internet service for $6 per day ( you cannot beat that). The pool was clean. My only down fall was the bars of soap the hotel supplied were no good. Meaning they cracked right away, but everything else was great. I recommend this to anyone young, adults, couples, guys night out, girls night out.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for our Wisconsin relatives”
Reviews.Author: Wibigmama1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our son's wedding which took place in the Silent Movie theatre about 1/2 mile away. We were very pleasantly surprised by the cleanliness and uniqueness of the rooms and friendliness of the personnel and the location. It was great for us because we didn't want to drive if we could help it in LA. The Farmer's Market/shopping centers/Hollywood/walk of stars etc were all very close. We would highly recommend it. The size made it easy for our group to contact each other. We booked online so had no real idea what it would be like, but it was great for us. The renovated rooms had a 70's feel and were very nice. Wish I had known about the kitchen units which would have worked better for us. Also, the Swinger's restaurant on site was fantastic

Reviews.Title: “Great Unique Rooms”
Reviews.Author: BobbyFrings
Reviews.Content: The rooms as the Beverly Laurel can't be beat. First, they are huge, or at least mine was. Second, they have a lovely set-up, with a kitchen, bar and seating area. The location is also great, right in the middle of LA, in a clean, safe neighborhood and everything is a short drive away.

Reviews.Title: “slice of Americana”
Reviews.Author: Tom_Cobbley
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in April for 2 nights, though have visited and stayed here many times before. I visit LA frequently and sometimes have tried out other places at a similar price level, but always come back to the Beverly Laurel. The rooms are a good enough size, the bathrooms can be small, but they're always clean. The bed's are a good size, decor is neutral and slightly arty, the TV has plenty of channel choice, and the local phone calls via the hotel's phone aren't extortionate. And the hotel has a classic mid-20th century 'Americana' look which I really like. Staff on reception are always helpful, the parking's free and then you've got Swingers Diner on the ground floor, which is worth the stay in itself. Come to think of it, I don't think I've ever had a bad stay or negative experience at the Beverly Laurel, and at this price, I cannot recommend the place highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: cubswin1234
Reviews.Content: Spent a long weekend here. Room was large with a small kitchenette. Very close to everything. Farmers market and the grove are 1/2 mile away. Beverly center is 15 minute walk. Close to freeway access. Swingers diner downstairs is great. Ate both breakfest and dinner there and its good food. Beds were comfortable. Room clean. Can't ask for much more

Reviews.Title: “Location only”
Reviews.Author: artttex
Reviews.Content: Was there in 2006. just to check L.A. during my stay in USA. First must say that 90 $ looks too much for service you getting here. It's more like a motel and just a place to sleep, and those places are usualy not worth of 90-100 bucks per night. Yes location is good , you are close(considering that you are in city of 17 million) to many sights like Farmers Market,CBS studios(two minutes walk),Walk Of Fame, Melrose Avenue,Sunset Boulevard, even Beverly Hills with Rodeo drive(more or less 10-15 minutes with taxi),etc... If I'm right, closest shoping mall was Beverly Center (just left, 15 minutes walk), with Macy's and Bloomingdales,there is also some nice restaurants with wide price range... Room was kept clean, with kitchenette, simple bathroom, TV was old and not working,bed comfortable... All in all, if you need just place to sleep, wants solid location and cruising the city during the day, this could be it... Not delighted, but not so dissapointed neither...

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: MelbourneCess
Reviews.Content: Like some of the other reviewers, I was rather apprehensive at staying here due to the lack of website or photos. I must say this place is definitely better than I had anticipated, not because I was expecting the worst, but honestly I was impressed by the 1) size of the room 2) investment made in the bathroom (stone top, moderately expensive looking tiles) 3) plasma TV 4) helpfulness of the cleaning staff 5) value for money (~USD100). Agreed that the lift needs dressing up. Curiously the motel was advertised as being located in West Hollywood when I booked last year. It is close enough anyway, and you certainly can't find anything at this price range in W. Hollywood. Swingers diners downstairs has superb food and good coffee, great prices and a relaxed atmosphere. I wish we had the diner concept in Australia. I would not hesistate in recommending the motel to anyone wanting to stay around this area. Keep up the good work guys.

Reviews.Title: “Must suck to be me”
Reviews.Author: M0vin0n
Reviews.Content: Elevator was dirty and smelled - the bed had cigarette holes or moth holes in the blankets. The Real BIG Surprise was @ 5 a.m. when I went to take a shower, there was NO shower head and what was there had absolutely no pressure. Now wherever I travel, that is the 1st thing I look for, so there are no early morning surprises. I called 3 wks ahead & was guaranteed ground floor near parking lot - when I arrived, I got 2nd floor at the street - front desk said take it or leave it - an overall horrible experience!

Reviews.Title: “This place has bed bugs”
Reviews.Author: Angfla
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed in room 321 on 4/13/07 - 4/16/07 and came home covered in bed bug bites. I have them all over my arms, face, feet and back. Not a pleasant experience and now I have to worry that I might have brought them home with me. Everything other reviewers have said about the noise is true. People laughed, screamed and rode the very noisy elevator (just outside our room) all night long. The carpets were dirty. The fridge didn't work. The night clerk was incredibly rude. When we took our complaints to the manager he very flippantly dismissed them and didn't offer to reduce our bill in any way. Disgusting place, bad service.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great value, excllent location!!”
Reviews.Author: Smartypunk
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed here for a long weekend in February 2007. Nice, clean room. Great googie/60's motor hotel. The location was perfect. Swingers, the diner at the hotel, has one of the best Bloody Mary's I've had in ages (and the food was great, too)!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Laurence_and_Trudi
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Beverly laurel for 2 nights, on our first trip to America, on our way to Vegas. We wanted a place that was in West Hollywood, was fun, and was reasonably priced! From menory, it was approx US$100 a night. We read about the Beverly Laurel here on Trip Advisor, but unfortunatly, they dont have a website, so we felt like we were booking a bit blind, so we were a bit unsure about what we'd walk into! The people there were friendly, and happy to point us in the right direction for things to see. The hotel itself is pretty basic, but its clean and comfortable; it was well serviced both days we were there. Its by a reasonably busy street, but we didnt notice any noise at all. We thought it was really good value for money. It was a great intro to America, and we enjoyed our stay. There is an excellent diner downstairs called Swingers. I had the best burger that I'ver ever tasted there! I'd go back there just for the burger! The location is great, just down the road from Farmers Market (really nice), and a $10 cab ride to either Sunset Bvld, or Hollywood Bvld. We'd recomment it if you want a place with some spirit, and dont need luxury!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place. Great Value”
Reviews.Author: greenportsalty
Reviews.Content: We stay here every time we visit our california children and grand child. (So far, four visits over the last four years.) It's a great place, very friendly and helpful management--one reviewer called the management "stern" -- I can't imagine whom they encountered. Robert, the proprietor, could not be friendlier or of more assistance. Rooms are generous sized and comfortable, if a little funky, but what the hell, it's West Hollywood. Pool is excellent and all the service staff very accomodating.

Reviews.Title: “value for money”
Reviews.Author: RacheleAustralia
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 5 (3 children) and have been traveling the world for a year now so we have stayed in our share of hotels. We chose this one purely due to its location and other trip advisor reviews. We have never stayed in a motel before - so we were curious about the difference. Granted this is no Hilton but is great value for money. 1. It is clean. Our room was located on the second floor in the corner. No smells what so ever, clean towels and sheets changed daily 2. It is quiet. Surprisingly so due to the fact that a popular restaurant is located on the ground floor. 3. It has a pool. A necessity for 3 young children at the peak of summer 4. It has a kitchen. A bit sparse on the cutlery and crockery but enough for some breakfast - we wouldnâ€™t cook major dinners though 5. It has a television. Not all 100 or so cable channels but enough to keep us all entertained 6. Room was spacious. Enough to fit 6 large suitcases plus all of us. Now there were two double beds. We are used to a queen so was a bit tight for us. Mattresses were a little squeaky for two - pillows could do with some updating as well. Otherwise great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Love it ”
Reviews.Author: cattytrip
Reviews.Content: I stay here whenever in LA. In fact my mum has stayed here a few times and they have taken AWESOME care of her. Honestly I love this joint - clean, QUIET, awesome location AND free parking. Can't get better.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were initially put off by the fact that the hotel had no website or online contacts so when booking from another country it is hard to know what you are getting into. We stayed at the Beverly Laurel on a one month tour of California and it was fantastic. We had stayed at more expensive hotels during our trip but this was by far the best. The bathroom was great with twin head showers and a double basin. The rooms were clean and the staff were really helpful. The location is also great with The Grove shopping centre just a short walk away and Beverly Hills and Hollywood in close proximity. For the money I couldn't recommend it any more.

Reviews.Title: “A very cool hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is far from anything luxurious but it doesen't matter. Good location, helpful staff, cool atmosphere. Very L.A. Have stayed there two times and keep coming back. The diner, Swingers, on the ground floor has the best blueberry shake EVER!

Reviews.Title: “you're paying for the location”
Reviews.Author: Barbara R
Reviews.Content: My 2 daughters and I arrived in LA from Las Vegas and booked into the BL after reading the tripadvisor reviews. Well all I can say is that this is a 50 buck fleabag motel which charges $60 for its fabulous location (and it really is great) Our room stank of smoke, it was in the sheets and the pillows. The 'renovation' it had undergone was very superficial as the fittings were still all 40 years old. The rooms were very noisy, the stairways dark and dingy, and we didn't feel very secure. While the staff were friendly we couldn't wait to get out of there - to a less fantastic location where $110 plus tax buys you a decent room.

Reviews.Title: “not for those with a nose”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the BL last saturday night, and though i had requested a non smoking room, and made a separate phone call to that effect, we were given a smoking room - but the host promised it would be okay because that room had just been shampooed. which actually meant that the carpet was wet for our entire overnight stay, all the pillows and blankets still smelled of smoke and musty odors, and by morning whatever allergens (mold, mildew) present in the carpet gave my five year old son such a reaction that he was sneezing and miserable for the next five hours. the coffee shop, however, was great. said five year old son was in love his waitress. this hotel is for hipsters like the ones two doors down from us smoking some interesting herbal cigarettes. great for college kids who have less money and dont have asthma. not so great if you want the illusion of cleanliness and fresh linens - but it's cheap! and go to swingers. oh, and all that retro style. too bad they didnt spend a little less money at dwr and a little more on some dysons.

Reviews.Title: “Good, simple hotel”
Reviews.Author: twighlightMoon
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed staying here. I only stayed one night, by myself on a business trip. As a woman traveling alone, I felt safe. The location is ideal, at a reasonable price, and the diner attached is a definite bonus. For those traveling here on vacation, the Farmer's Market a few blocks away is an interesting place to check out, though it's grown into a huge shopping mall nowadays. The guy at the front counter was real nice and helpful, and the rooms were clean and decent. I'd stay again sometime.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Excellent value for this part of LA. I live here but had some friends visiting and I choose the Beverly laurel because of it's location really. The staff is very friendly, rooms, spacious and clean. Walking distance to The Grove and many other places. Definitely recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location, clean, tidy, cable tv, frdige, free parking & the best diner next door! What more can you desire for $100 in la? The Beverly Laurel is a good value hotel which ticks all the right boxes. Ok, so the building is a little old, and the room was a little cold (especially in the recent storms!) but we found the hotel extremely good value. We turned up with a view to moving to the Standard or a more upmarket hotel but we just couldn't bring ourselves to leave. We ended up staying for 7 nights. Great location for the Grove or Beverly malls and convenient for Hollywood/Sunset. Also, the Swingers diner rocked - breakfast for under $4 b4 11, friendly servers. We also stayed at the Le Montrose Suite (which with parking was $170) but prefered this hands down! We kept the difference and went shopping!

Reviews.Title: “A good value and recommended”
Reviews.Author: Venturezozo
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Beverly Laurel for two nights in August 2004. I was quite satisfied with my experience. It was clean and charming, a cut above the standard motel decor. I did not notice any smell or other unpleasant odors - and I consider myself quite discerning and something of a "Felix Unger." Great location and I would stay there again, absolutely.

Reviews.Title: “Cool Accommodation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 2 nights last week had a great time, rooms were clean and comfortable, manager friendly - looked after our bags after we checked out for a whole day.Diner on the premises "Swingers" is the best cheap place we went to on our whole US holiday including New York and the waitresses ROCK! Don't take any notice of negative comments this place is CHEAP great location, clean as a whistle and COOL.

Reviews.Title: “OK, good for the price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was basically what I expected for $100 a nite in West LA. The room we stayed in was smelly, pretty bad but not unbearable. The windows were kept open most of the time. The rooms were average size, a little shabby and worn but clean. The bathroom was clean but small and only had a shower. The pool was very cold (unheated) but since it was a hot weekend, it was refreshing. The main draw to this hotel is the price and the location. 5 minutes to the sunset strip, beverly hills and hollywood and right next to the grove, we walked to the farmers market for breakfast. It was a bit far from a freeway, and of course in LA that slows you down a lot.

Reviews.Title: “do not recommend at all”
Reviews.Author: BayAreaLoveLetters
Reviews.Content: I absolutely do not recommend this hotel. We stayed here (with our dog) largely based on the reviews on this site. we brought a scented candle beause of the reviews about smelly rooms. ours was smelly--smelled like mildew and the candle helped some. i could've dealt with the smell but the biggest problem was noise. people treated this "hotel" as a place to party; the acoustics are awful; and people woke us up with screams throughout the night. the hotel staff seemed to turn a blind eye. the room next to ours was rented out and was used for a play in the evening (about 9:30)! the people were yelling "----," screaming at each other, and slamming doors all as part of the play (we didn't know till later it as a play and it was not just disturbing but terrifying as well--especiallyto our dog). the beds were the worse ive ever slept on (way too soft). we slept on the floor the 2nd night (didn't have time to find a new hotel with our pet as we had a busy schedule in LA with vartious friends) as my back went out and i had to use ointment on it for most of the trip. the almost 24 hour diner below also adds noise to the hotel. this is absolutely the worst place ive ever stayed in and i am not too picky. as stated i was prepared to deal with the smell but it was impossible to get rest day or night in this hotel. to be fair, the manager did reduce our bill by some amount after we complaned about the noise and the play (about 15-20 peope were in one room watching the play and then later standing directly outside our room talking loudly about it and congratulations the actors etc) if you want rest go elsewhere, if you want to stay up late and party and dont need much else stay at the beverly laurel.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME PLACE!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Beverly Laurel is fantastic! Great location and excellent rooms. Priced right. One of LA's best kept secrets. The diner ajoining the hotel - 'Swingers' - is very funky with ever helpful staff. Only a short walk to most of LA's top shoping or attractions. Friendly staff and quiet at night. I will definately be staying at the Beverly Laurel on my return trip to the United States!
